subject: [Lab 04] Q4: List Indexing
content:
Q4: List Indexing

Please post all questions you have below concerning Q4: List Indexing in the follow-ups.

If you are stuck on this question, feel free to read through the follow-up responses to see if you can draw any ideas from them.

threads.question: Hi - I just reached this question and I'm still a little unfamiliar with lists, so I don't know exactly what to do for this question. Are there are any suggestions as to how I should start this question?

follow-ups.feedback: Have you looked at the mini summary of the topic that appears in the beginning of the lab under Topics?

threads.question: Im just double checking; we are supposed to implement recursion for the list problems, yes?

follow-ups.feedback: Oh I did. so I should change it then? Or does it not matter?

Ideally, you would utilize list comprehensions as that is a very important concept that will appear on exams, so it's good to get the practice in for that, although what you have currently is enough for full credit.

threads.question: Hi,  I fin unlocking all the tests for this question but when I checked score it says 0 for that one?

follow-ups.feedback: Ah got it, it's out of 0
just like my amount of sleep
